about.aboutp1: I am a Junior Full Stack Developer. My fascination with technology led me to a web development bootcamp, where I immersed myself in creating innovative digital solutions.
about.aboutp2: Besides my background in philology, my ability to learn languages translates into a unique capacity to tackle challenges from various perspectives. Thanks to my journey, I quickly adapt to dynamic environments and effectively collaborate with diverse teams.
about.aboutp3: My passion is web development, and I'm excited to contribute to the tech world with creative solutions. I'm always open to new opportunities for learning and collaboration.

projects.description: Recreation of the project 'My TuttiFrutti App' using ReactJS and NodeJS, as well as a custom database generated with PostgreSQL. The project it is based on can be visited on my GitHub page. Fullstack web application that displays nutritional data of different fruits consumed in Spain, as well as their comparison through charts created with react-chartjs-2. It also includes an extra section that shows the different uses that can be given to different fruits in daily nutrition.

Event management web page. It allows you to visit the details of each event. Once a user is created and logged in, they can also create / modify / delete their own events. Phase two will include an option to confirm attendance at events and see who will attend. Final personal project of the FullStack Web Development Bootcamp at The Bridge where a fullstack web application is created with ReactJS and NodeJS, as well as a database generated with PostgreSQL.

Web application created with React that functions as a Pokédex interacting with the PokeApi to display the details of each Pokémon. It allows searches by the Pokémon's ID or name, as well as creating new Pokémon with react-hook-form saved in the context. It is a project that is part of the evolution of learning during the FullStack Web Development Bootcamp at The Bridge and practices the use of useDebounce(), useEffect(), useState(), useContext(), and useParams().

Web application created with React that interacts with OpenWeather to display the weather forecast every three hours for the next five days based on the city searched by the user. It is a project that is part of the evolution of learning during the FullStack Web Development Bootcamp at The Bridge and practices the use of useDebounce(), useEffect(), useState(), useContext(), and useParams().

Second quiz practice, the first one is visitable on my GitHub. Created with Vanilla, it makes requests to Open DB to create a quiz with a television theme and random questions provided by the API. Styled like a teletext to match the quiz theme. It has been managed with Firebase for user data and their progress in each quiz completion.
